Definitive Q&A: Enterprise CRO Strategy
What is the difference between CRO and SEO?

SEO focuses on driving traffic *to* your site, while CRO focuses on maximizing the value of that traffic *once it arrives*. CRO turns visitors into customers, effectively lowering your Customer Acquisition Cost (CAC).

How do you determine statistical significance?

We use a Bayesian statistical model to determine test winners, requiring a minimum 95% confidence interval before declaring a variation successful. This ensures that revenue uplifts are due to our changes, not random chance.

Can you optimize for metrics other than revenue?

Yes. While revenue is the primary goal, we also optimize for micro-conversions like email signups, demo requests, account creations, and engagement metrics (time on site, pages per session) that lead to long-term value.
